title: Augusta County: Henry H. Dedrick to Mary E. A. Dedrick, June 9, 1863
summary: Dedrick describes troop movements and skirmishes near Culpeper, Virginia. He also complains of soreness from the march and talks about his courtmartial.
keywords: Battle Description, Camp Life, Desertion/Leave, Family, Military Authority, Military Strategy, Prison/Prisoners, Troop Movement, American Civil War
